text: Amélie Simone Mauresmo (born 5 July 1979) is a French retired tennis player. Mauresmo was born in Saint-Germain-en-Laye. She turned professional in 1993. She was the world number 1 women's singles from 13 September to 17 October 2004 and from 20 March to 12 November 2006. She won a silver medal in singles at the 2004 Summer Olympics. In 2006, she won the Australian Open and Wimbledon. She retired in 2009. She is openly lesbian.Amélie Mauresmo retires from tennis In June 2014, Mauresmo became Andy Murray's coach. == References == == Other websites == *Official site * Category:1979 births Category:Australian Open champions Category:Tennis coaches Category:French tennis players Category:French LGBT people Category:Lesbians Category:Living people Category:LGBT sportspeople Category:Medalists at the 2004 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic silver medalists for France Category:People from Yvelines Category:Wimbledon champions Category:World No. 1 tennis players Category:Sportspeople from Île-de-France
title: Amélie Mauresmo
